2 inmate deaths in 7 months at Essex County Jail in Newark:

text: This will cover more impoverished immigrants who need representation, but not most. By contrast immigrants who live in New York & are held at the Bergen and Hudson County jails have lawyers paid for by New York. Lawyers exponentially decrease the chance of deportation.

text: This comes as jail faces scrutiny over its lucrative contract & conditions described as poor by ICE’s own inspector general. Activists have been going to meetings for months demanding that freeholders & County Exec Joe DiVincenzo use profits to aid immigrants or cancel contract.

text: News: Immigrants detained at the Essex County Jail are getting attorneys: Essex County officials announced tonight that it is dedicating $750,000 from its $40 million annual ICE to fund lawyers for the ~900 immigrants held there. @GovMurphy’s budget funds some attorneys already.
